timeline.message: Add IndexDocumentsOptions, moved other option models into new options package, removed implementation from public API, and move field builder code into samples

timeline.bodyText:
We have several other options in indexes.
Do we only put seachClient related options in option bag?
timeline.author: sima-zhu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,7 @@
+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License.
+
+/**
+ * Package containing the classes which serve as options to APIs.
+ */
+package com.azure.search.documents.options;

replies.bodyText: Moving classes back to original location as they don't fit the guideline for option bags.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.message: Updated paged response constructors, moved options classes back into models

timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+// Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.
+// Licensed under the MIT License.
+
+package com.azure.search.documents.options;
+
+import com.azure.core.annotation.Fluent;
+
+/**
+ * Options for document index operations.
+ */
+@Fluent
+public class IndexDocumentsOptions {
+    private boolean throwOnAnyError = false;

replies.bodyText:
.NET is using false by default. https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-net/blob/master/sdk/search/Azure.Search.Documents/src/Options/IndexDocumentsOptions.cs#L19
@tg-msft @heaths could explain the reasoning better.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Personally prefer to take true, as we have retry helper inside of IndexBatchException.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.message: Update IndexDocumentsOptions to default throwOnAnyError to true
